summary.span: 表示由 類別 (Class) 用來控制序列化 (Serialization) 的抽象類別。

span.span: Represents an abstract class used for controlling serialization by the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在初始化期間，.NET Framework XML 序列化基礎結構以動態方式產生並編譯序列化衍生自抽象的暫時類別類別。During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for serialization that is derived from the abstract class. 同時也會進行序列化的.NET Framework 中實作和成 XML 文件的物件。 is also implemented within the .NET Framework for serialization of and objects into XML documents. 您不應衍生的類別。You should not derive classes from . 請改為呼叫方法。Instead, call the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 受保護的成員供只會在內部使用.NET Framework XML 序列化基礎結構內的衍生類別所使用。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. 在初始化期間，.NET Framework XML 序列化基礎結構以動態方式產生並編譯序列化衍生自的暫時類別。During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for serialization that is derived from . 在此過程中，.NET Framework 會產生寫入方法可實作委派。During this process, the .NET Framework generates write methods that implement the delegate. 它會讓特定.NET Framework 型別與 XML 資料型別會透過 SOAP 編碼的 XML 序列化，並不是根項目之間的對應。It does so for certain mappings between .NET Framework types and XML data types that are serialized via SOAP-encoded XML and are not root elements. 然後，如有必要，序列化期間會呼叫寫入方法。Then, as necessary, a write method is called during serialization. 您不應該直接建立的執行個體。You should not directly create an instance of . SOAP 編碼為 SOAP 1.1 規格的第 5 節中所述。SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法會將有效的 XML 寫入無效的來源。The method writes valid XML from invalid sources. 例如，屬性類別可以包含空格，也就是以 XML 無效。For example, the property of the class can contain spaces, which are invalid as XML. 方法讀取編碼的 XML，並將它還原為原始值。The method reads the encoded XML and restores it to the original value. 不過，方法無法讀取這類編碼的 XML。However, the method of the cannot read such encoded XML. 在此情況下，設定屬性`false`停用的 XML 編碼方式。In that case, set the property to `false` to disable the encoding of the XML.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 受保護的成員供只會在內部使用.NET Framework XML 序列化基礎結構內的衍生類別所使用。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. 在初始化期間，.NET Framework XML 序列化基礎結構以動態方式產生並編譯序列化衍生自的暫時類別。During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for serialization that is derived from . 在此過程中，.NET Framework 會產生寫入方法可實作委派。During this process, the .NET Framework generates write methods that implement the delegate. 它會讓特定.NET Framework 型別與 XML 資料型別會使用 SOAP 編碼的 XML 序列化，並不是根項目之間的對應。It does so for certain mappings between .NET Framework types and XML data types that are serialized using SOAP-encoded XML and are not root elements. 然後，如有必要，序列化期間會呼叫寫入方法。Then, as necessary, a write method is called during serialization. 抽象方法為暫時的衍生的類別中建立的執行個體，而初始化撰寫回呼方法。The abstract method is where the temporary derived class creates an instance of and initializes write callback methods. 您不應該直接建立的執行個體。You should not directly create an instance of . SOAP 編碼為 SOAP 1.1 規格的第 5 節中所述。SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 受保護的成員供只會在內部使用.NET Framework XML 序列化基礎結構內的衍生類別所使用。The protected members of are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure. SOAP 編碼允許唯一的 XML 項目出現一次為 SOAP 訊息內`multiRef`所識別的項目`id`屬性。SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `multiRef` element identified by an `id` attribute. `id`值可以由參考多次`href`屬性 (或`ref`SOAP 1.2 內的屬性) 的替代項目。The `id` value can be referenced multiple times by `href` attributes (or `ref` attributes in SOAP 1.2) in substitute elements. SOAP 編碼為 SOAP 1.1 規格的第 5 節中所述。SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

SOAP 編碼允許唯一的 XML 項目出現一次為 SOAP 訊息內``所識別的項目`id`屬性。SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `` element identified by an `id` attribute. `id`值可以是參考的多次`href`屬性 (或`ref`SOAP 1.2 內的屬性) 的替代項目。The `id` value can be referenced multiple times using `href` attributes (or `ref` attributes in SOAP 1.2) in substitute elements.
